bioghist.p: Richard Vaux held a number of local and federal offices, including secretary to the Legation at London, Comptroller of Public Schools, and Mayor of Philadelphia.

scopecontent.p: These papers are mostly from Vaux's term as Philadelphia Recorder, a judicial office in which he served from 1841 to 1847, and where he established a record in that not one of his decisions was ever reversed by the higher courts. The papers concern 21 police cases in the Recorder's office during 1840-42, including affadavits, commitments, extradition warrants, bailments, and other material. There are also five items dealing with the state constitution enacted January 1, 1874 and its relation to the city of Philadelphia.
